general_tips.tip: Visit museums within the first hour of opening to avoid crowds and have the best experience with popular exhibits.
general_tips.reasoning: Early morning visits typically have 50-70% fewer visitors. Most tour groups arrive after 10 AM.

general_tips.tip: Visit popular landmarks either early morning (sunrise) or late evening (sunset) for best photos and fewer crowds.
general_tips.reasoning: Golden hour provides best lighting. Most tourists visit midday. Temperature is also more comfortable.

general_tips.tip: Eat 1-2 hours before or after peak times (lunch: 12-2 PM, dinner: 7-9 PM) for shorter waits and sometimes better service.
general_tips.reasoning: Off-peak dining often means less crowded restaurants and more attention from staff.

general_tips.tip: Book tickets for popular attractions 2-4 weeks in advance, especially during peak season.
general_tips.reasoning: Most major attractions have limited capacity. Online booking often includes skip-the-line benefits.

general_tips.tip: Purchase tickets online when available - often saves 30-60 minutes of queue time at the venue.
general_tips.reasoning: Ticket counter lines can take 1-2 hours at popular sites. Many venues offer fast-track entry for online bookings.

general_tips.tip: Local markets and street food are typically 50-70% cheaper than restaurants in tourist areas while offering authentic experiences.
general_tips.reasoning: Tourist area restaurants markup prices significantly. Local spots offer genuine cuisine at local prices.

general_tips.tip: Lunch menus and early bird specials can be 30-40% cheaper than dinner at the same restaurants.
general_tips.reasoning: Many restaurants offer lunch specials. Same quality food at lower daytime prices.

general_tips.tip: Many cities offer free walking tours (tip-based), free museum days (often first Sunday of month), and free public parks.
general_tips.reasoning: Quality experiences don't always require payment. Research free alternatives.

general_tips.tip: Staying 2-3 metro stops outside the city center can save 30-50% on accommodation while maintaining easy access.
general_tips.reasoning: Accommodation prices drop significantly outside tourist zones. Good public transport makes this practical.

general_tips.tip: Multi-day public transport passes are usually cheaper than individual tickets if you'll use transport 3+ times per day.
general_tips.reasoning: Day/week passes often break even after 3-4 trips. Offers unlimited travel convenience.

general_tips.tip: Walking between nearby attractions (under 2km) saves money and lets you discover hidden gems along the way.
general_tips.reasoning: Cities reveal their character in between major sites. Walking is free and healthy.

general_tips.tip: Avoid traveling during rush hours (7-9 AM, 5-7 PM) when possible - trains/buses are crowded and slower.
general_tips.reasoning: Rush hour means packed vehicles, longer travel times, and uncomfortable journeys.

general_tips.tip: Keep valuables in front pockets or inside jacket pockets, especially in crowded tourist areas and public transport.
general_tips.reasoning: Pickpockets target back pockets and loose bags in crowded areas.

general_tips.tip: Keep digital and physical copies of important documents (passport, insurance, bookings) separate from originals.
general_tips.reasoning: Losing documents can ruin a trip. Backups enable quick recovery and replacement.

general_tips.tip: Learn basic greetings (hello, thank you, please) in the local language - locals greatly appreciate the effort.
general_tips.reasoning: Shows respect and often leads to better service and friendly interactions.

general_tips.tip: Research dress codes for religious sites - carry a scarf/shawl for covering shoulders/head when required.
general_tips.reasoning: Many religious sites enforce dress codes. Being prepared avoids disappointment.

general_tips.tip: Balance high-energy activities with relaxing ones to avoid burnout. Don't over-schedule - leave buffer time.
general_tips.reasoning: Travel fatigue is real. Rushed itineraries reduce enjoyment. Flexibility allows spontaneity.

general_tips.tip: Add 20-30 minute buffer between activities for unexpected delays, bathroom breaks, and spontaneous discoveries.
general_tips.reasoning: Things rarely go exactly as planned. Buffers reduce stress and allow flexibility.

general_tips.tip: Have indoor backup options (museums, shopping malls, cafes) planned for unexpected bad weather.
general_tips.reasoning: Weather changes can disrupt outdoor plans. Indoor alternatives save the day.

general_tips.tip: Limit daily travel to 30-50km in cities to avoid spending too much time in transit.
general_tips.reasoning: Excessive travel time reduces actual activity time and causes fatigue.

general_tips.tip: Group nearby attractions together on the same day to minimize backtracking and travel time.
general_tips.reasoning: Geographic clustering is more efficient. Reduces travel fatigue and costs.

general_tips.tip: Carry a refillable water bottle and stay hydrated, especially when walking extensively in warm weather.
general_tips.reasoning: Dehydration causes fatigue and health issues. Most cities have water fountains.

general_tips.tip: Schedule at least one slow morning or afternoon every 2-3 days to rest and recharge.
general_tips.reasoning: Continuous activity leads to burnout. Rest improves overall trip enjoyment.

general_tips.tip: Best photography happens during golden hour (first/last hour of sunlight) for warm, dramatic lighting.
general_tips.reasoning: Professional photographers universally recommend golden hour for best results.

general_tips.tip: For crowd-free photos at popular spots, arrive 30 minutes before opening time.
general_tips.reasoning: Early arrival ensures empty backgrounds and better compositions.

constraint_wisdom.wisdom: For low budgets: Prioritize free/cheap attractions (parks, walking tours), eat at local spots not tourist areas, use public transport exclusively.
For medium budgets: Mix free and paid attractions, balance nice restaurants with local eateries, use public transport with occasional taxis.
For high budgets: Access premium experiences, dine at recommended restaurants, use taxis/private transport for convenience.
Allow 20-30 minutes travel time between activities in cities. Museums need 2-3 hours minimum. Quick visits rarely satisfy.
Match activities to interests but avoid repetition - don't schedule 3 museums back-to-back even for culture lovers.
constraint_wisdom.variety_guide: No more than 2 similar activities consecutively. Mix different experience types.

constraint_wisdom.wisdom: Relaxed pace: 2-3 activities per day maximum, longer durations at each place, longer meal breaks, buffer time for spontaneity.
Moderate pace: 4-5 activities per day, standard durations, balanced mix of major attractions and relaxation.
Packed pace: 6-7 activities per day, efficient transitions, early starts, less downtime. Requires good fitness level.
Must-visit places should be scheduled on different days if possible, during their optimal times (research opening hours and crowd patterns).
constraint_wisdom.scheduling_rule: Distribute must-visits across different days. Schedule during recommended times.

best_practices: Arrive within first hour of opening
Many offer free entry on specific days
Wear comfortable shoes - lots of walking
Visit during golden hour for photos
Allow time for surrounding area exploration
Eat during off-peak hours for better service
common_mistakes: Not checking dress codes for upscale places
Arriving at peak times without reservation

best_practices: Good for picnics (buy from local shops)
Visit during non-service times if possible
Visit in morning for freshest products
common_mistakes: Only looking, not trying local foods
